intro: Delphinium pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils. Delphinium pumilum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and alpine settings.
